## How to Update Your 4G Systems XSBox GO+ Firmware

 


 
# How to Update Your 4G Systems XSBox GO+ Firmware
 
The 4G Systems XSBox GO+ is a portable device that allows you to create a secure WLAN hotspot and access the Internet via mobile networks. It supports up to 8 WLAN devices simultaneously and has a microSD slot for data storage. The device also has a mini-SIM card holder and works with all common operating systems.
 
## 4g-systems-xsbox-go-firmware-update


[**DOWNLOAD**](https://www.google.com/url?q=https%3A%2F%2Fblltly.com%2F2tLz3n&sa=D&sntz=1&usg=AOvVaw2CAn2hZmHyGvglLaDS9C0N)

 
To ensure the optimal performance and security of your XSBox GO+, you should update its firmware regularly. Firmware updates can fix bugs, improve stability, and add new features to your device. In this article, we will show you how to update your 4G Systems XSBox GO+ firmware in a few simple steps.
 
## Step 1: Download the latest firmware file
 
The first step is to download the latest firmware file from the 4G Systems website. You can find the download link here: [https://www.4g-systems.com/support/download/download-introductions/](https://www.4g-systems.com/support/download/download-introductions/)
 
Depending on your operating system, you need to download either the XSManager\_Windows.exe or the XSManager\_Mac.dmg file. These files contain the latest XSManager software and the firmware update for your XSBox GO+. Save the file to your computer and remember its location.
 
## Step 2: Connect your XSBox GO+ to your computer
 
The next step is to connect your XSBox GO+ to your computer using the USB cable that came with the device. Make sure the device is turned on and has enough battery power. You should also remove any SIM card or microSD card from the device before updating.
 
Once you connect your XSBox GO+ to your computer, it should be recognized as a removable drive. You can access its contents by opening the File Explorer on Windows or the Finder on Mac.
 
## Step 3: Run the XSManager software
 
The third step is to run the XSManager software that you downloaded in step 1. If you are using Windows, double-click on the XSManager\_Windows.exe file. If you are using Mac, double-click on the XSManager\_Mac.dmg file and then drag the XSManager icon to the Applications folder.
 
After running the XSManager software, you should see a window that shows the status of your XSBox GO+. Click on the Settings icon on the top right corner and then select Firmware Update from the menu.
 
## Step 4: Follow the instructions to update your firmware
 
The final step is to follow the instructions on the screen to update your firmware. The XSManager software will automatically detect the firmware version of your XSBox GO+ and compare it with the latest version available online. If there is a newer version, you will see a message that prompts you to update.
 
Click on Yes to start the update process. Do not disconnect or turn off your device during the update. The update may take several minutes to complete. When it is done, you will see a message that confirms the successful update.
 
Congratulations! You have successfully updated your 4G Systems XSBox GO+ firmware. You can now disconnect your device from your computer and enjoy its improved performance and features.
